sense.name: a manner or method of doing something
sense.examples: The man walked down the street in a peculiar fashion. The refugees assembled at the food tents in an orderly fashion. John, in his typical fashion, was late for the meeting.

sense.name: a popular trend or mode
sense.examples: This magazine shows all the latest fashions from Paris and Milan. She wanted to be part of the fashion scene. It's a fashion of hairstyle you don't see much in Asia.

sense.name: approximately, sort of
sense.examples: The students have learned to type, after a fashion. I guess you could say he's running the family business, after a fashion.

sense.name: in a manner similar to
sense.examples: She took time for granted after the fashion of wealthy and pampered girls. Mary decorated her dining room in the fashion of the Art Deco movement.

sense.name: unfavorable, not popular
sense.examples: It's a style of window treatment that has largely fallen out of fashion. That style of populist politician fell out of fashion in the 19th century.
